case_title: Assistant Commissioner, Unit-16, SRB vs M/s Target TMC (Pvt.) Limited

accussed_details.name: M/s Target TMC (Pvt.) Limited
allegation: Failure to file tax returns for July, August, September 2014
Failure to pay tax for the same period

complaint_summary: The Assistant Commissioner, SRB alleged that M/s Target TMC (Pvt.) Limited failed to file tax returns and pay taxes for July, August, and September 2014 despite being liable under tariff heading 9805.5100 effective from 01.07.2014.
investigation_summary: Show cause notice issued on 21.01.2015 was not responded. Tax returns were eventually filed on 11.02.2015. Penalty imposed under Section 43(2) from due dates till filing of returns on 11.12.2015.
judgment_summary: The Appellate Tribunal upheld the Commissioner (Appeals)' decision to reduce the penalty period to start from the date of registration (15.11.2014) rather than the due dates prior to registration. The appeal was rejected.
punishment: Penalty imposed from the date of registration (15.11.2014) till filing of returns on 11.12.2015.
legal_arguments: Section 2(71) does not allow penalty for non-filing of returns before registration.
Section 30 and Rule 12 specify filing requirements for registered persons only.
National Asset Management Co. Ltd. judgment cited as precedent.
statutes: Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
citations: National Asset Management Co. Ltd. v/s Commissioner (Appeals), SRB and another (09.04.2015)
key_issues: Liability for penalties prior to registration

maxims.Ratio decidendi: Penalty cannot be imposed for non-filing of returns before registration.

legal_terms.Registered Person: A person officially registered under the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011.
legal_terms.Penalty: A financial punishment for failing to comply with tax filing obligations.

words_and_phrases.Liable to be registered: A person required to register under the tax law but not yet registered.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the interpretation of tax filing obligations for unregistered persons under Section 2(71) of the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011. The Appellate Tribunal upheld the Commissioner (Appeals)' decision to limit penalties to the period post-registration, rejecting the appeal filed by the Assistant Commissioner, SRB.

appeal_details.commissioner_appeals_decision: Penalty calculated from registration date (2014-11-15) instead of due dates.

legal_findings.definition_interpreted: Section 2(71) defines 'registered person' and includes exceptions for unregistered persons.
legal_findings.tribunal_decision: Penalty cannot be imposed for periods prior to registration.
legal_findings.commissioner_appeals_followed: Tribunal precedent upheld; liabilities accrue from registration date.
